contentrichtext.text: The '''Veterans Freedom Party''' (originally '''Veterans Federation Party''') is a [[political party|party-list]] in the [[Philippines]]. It is the electoral wing of the [[Veterans Federation of the Philippines]]. In the [[Philippine general election, 2004|2004 elections]] for the [[House of Representatives of the Philippines|House of Representatives]] the party-list got 340,759 votes (2.6785% of the nationwide vote)<ref>[http://www.comelec.gov.ph/results/2004partylist.html COMELEC Election Results<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and one seat ([[Ernesto Gidaya]]).<ref>[http://www.congress.gov.ph/members/search.php?id=gidaya House Members - House of Representatives of the Philippines<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> VFP was one of 5 party-lists said to have received presidential support in connection with the [[Hello Garci scandal|Garci tapes]] affair.<ref>[http://www.pcij.org/i-report/special/partylist.html Special Issue | Messing with the Party List<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Gidaya died on December 4, 2006. Two former candidates of the party contested to replace him, Estrella Santos and Rodolfo Gutang. Gutang is the general secretary of the party.<ref>[http://www.gov.ph/news/default.asp?i=7612 Gordon to DFA: Lobby for Fil Veterans : Philippines : Gov.Ph : News<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> ==Electoral performance== {|class=wikitable style="text-align:right" |- !Election !! Votes !! % !! Seats |- |align=left|[[Philippine House of Representatives elections, 1998|1998]] || 304,902 || 3.33% || 1 |- |align=left|[[Philippine House of Representatives elections, 2001|2001]] || 580,781 || 3.84% || 2 |- |align=left|[[Philippine House of Representatives elections, 2004|2004]] || 340,759 || 2.68% || 1 |- |align=left|[[Philippine House of Representatives elections, 2007|2007]] || 196,266 || 1.23% || 1 |- |align=left|[[Philippine House of Representatives elections, 2010|2010]] || 155,672 || 0.52% || 0 |} ==See also== *[[Veterans Federation Party]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://veteransfreedomparty.com Veterans Freedom Party Official website] {{Philippine political parties}} [[Category:Organizations participating in party-list elections in the Philippines]] {{philippines-party-stub}}
